definition: The distinctive personality and perspective of the writer that comes through in the prose

positive_examples: The writer's voice comes through in her characteristic humor and directness.
Finding your voice means developing a consistent, authentic perspective in your writing.
The corporate voice is neutral and impersonal; the blogger's voice is intimate and opinionated.
Voice distinguishes one author's writing from another's even on similar topics.
negative_examples: The text was written by someone.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distinctive authorial personality in prose, not just having a perspective
